Career Profile

  • I like to learn, understand and implement new technologies. Also I like the architecture and design part of the projects. I started working as an iOS developer for one year, then I switched to Java web for three years, I did some Python web with DJango for some months and finally I have spent my last years as an Android Software Engineer.
  • In my free time I like to learn and practice new technologies, programming languages by doing small proof of concepts with them.
  • I love the open source philosophy, I have contributed with some open source projects like RxPermissions among others. I have open sourced some small projects that have helped some people like firebase-cloning-tool and a couple more that I have deprecated like pikmail-api and pikmail.

Android Engineer @ MDLive through Nearsoft

February 2016 - June 2019
Mérida, Yucatán(remote)

  • Description: MDLive Nationwide telehealth platform with +1 million consultation and more than 100k installations from the ​Google Play Store​. App for consulting with certified Doctors by video calls.
  • Responsibilities: Member of the core team. ● Implement new features and fix production bugs. ● I helped with decisions in the architecture and software design of the app. We needed to provide a customizable SDK in order to provide doctor’s video calls support to third party apps. The app needed to supports multiple skins, we used flavors to accomplish that. ● When RxJava1 was deprecated I suggested to migrate all our whole project to RxJava2 and I offered myself to do that. This was challenging since RxJava used to support nulls in the stream but RxJava2 doesn’t. ● Since I have been writing Kotlin since 2015(I started with it for fun) I evaluated the use of Koltin in our project and migrate all our service(networking) layer to Kotlin. Now our codebase is 37% Kotlin and increasing.
  • Technology: Java, Kotlin, RxJava1/2, Dagger2, Retrofit, Firebase, Fabric, JUnit, Mockito, Robolectric, PowerMock, Travis, Jenkins

Mobile Engineer @ Kuona

January 2015 - October 2015
Monterrey, Nuevo León

  • Description: App for creating smart grocery shopping lists by telling you what supermarket has the cheaper shopping list around you.
  • Responsibilities: Migrate the Kuona Android app originally written in phonegap to Android native. ● Maintain the iOS phonegap version.
  • Technology: Java, Retrofit, Firebase, Geogencing, some JS and Python.
